classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.8, Section 2.2)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.STRAIN

datasetVariables.describedValueDomain: Mouse Genome Database; Rat Genome Database
datasetVariables.description:
Used to identify the vendor-supplied strain. 
 MGI Nomenclature should be used for mice. See http://www.informatics.jax.org/mgihome/nomen/strains.shtml 
 The Rat Genome Database should be used for rats. See https://rgd.mcw.edu 
 It is important that the full symbol for the strain, not an abbreviated form, be used. Because the .xpt format does not support superscripts, superscripted text should be enclosed in angle brackets (i.e., "<value>"). For example, "B6.Cg-Tyrc-2JHrhr/J" would be "B6.Cg-Tyr<c-2J>Hr<hr>/J". 
 The STRAIN codelist should be used for all species other than rats and mice.
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain
datasetVariables.name: STRAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Animal Rule Version 1.0 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SBSTRAIN

datasetVariables.description: Not used for rats and mice. Free-text field that allows the sponsor to enter further details qualifying the SPECIES and/or STRAIN, depending on the level to which these variables were defined. Examples include the description of a specific genetic alteration, country of origin for non-human primates, details related to coat color (e.g., white and red designations for New Zealand Rabbits), and important animal husbandry information (e.g., "SPF", "BR", "VAF").
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain Details
datasetVariables.name: SBSTRAIN

classes.description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Findings About Events or Interventions
classes.name: Findings About

classes.description: This SDTM class describes the plan for the procedures to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods, assignment of epochs that subjects pass through in the course of a trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103379, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Trial Design Model
classes.name: Trial Design
